meanings.definition: The quality or state of being knotty.
meanings.sent1: The knottiness of the rope made it hard to untangle.
meanings.sent2: The knottiness of the wood added character to the furniture.
meanings.sent3: The knottiness of the situation was like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were a knottiness of conflicting emotions.
meanings.sent5: The knottiness of the problem required careful unraveling.

meanings.definition: The presence of knots or tangled parts.
meanings.sent1: I struggled with the knottiness of the shoelaces.
meanings.sent2: The knottiness of the yarn made knitting challenging.
meanings.sent3: The knottiness of the garden hose caused a water spray mishap.
meanings.sent4: The knottiness of the necklace symbolized the complexity of relationships.
meanings.sent5: The knottiness of the tree roots created obstacles for the path.

meanings.definition: Complexity or difficulty in understanding or solving.
meanings.sent1: The knottiness of the math problem left me puzzled.
meanings.sent2: The knottiness of the legal jargon confused the students.
meanings.sent3: The knottiness of the riddle kept everyone entertained.
meanings.sent4: The knottiness of the mystery novel kept me guessing until the end.
meanings.sent5: The knottiness of the technology issue required expert assistance.
